item.title: 市场应对央行降息押注的变化
item.description: 各大央行已经结束了历史性的货币紧缩周期，但关于下一步谁将降息、降息幅度有多大的预测却迅速出现分歧。【原文：Big central banks have ended their historic monetary tightening cycle but predictions about who will cut rates next, and how deeply, are diverging fast.】

item.title: 美国财政部就发展中国家面临的资金紧张问题发出警报
item.description: 美国财政部一位高级官员周四将呼吁官方双边债权人采取果断、协调的行动，应对中低收入国家面临的日益恶化的金融挑战，并在必要时加快债务减免。【原文：A top U.S. Treasury official on Thursday will call for decisive, coordinated action by official bilateral creditors to address the worsening financial challenges faced by low- and middle-income countries and to speed up debt relief when needed.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚面临艰难的货币贬值决定以获得国际货币基金组织的救助
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）上周在未与埃塞俄比亚当局达成急需的协议的情况下离开了该国，埃塞俄比亚可能不得不尽早决定大幅货币贬值，以获得国际货币基金组织的救援贷款。【原文：Ethiopia may have to decide on a big currency devaluation sooner rather than later to secure a rescue loan from the International Monetary Fund (IMF), which left the country last week without reaching a much-needed deal with authorities.】

item.title: 数据公布后，美联储七月开始降息重回视野
item.description: 在一份政府报告显示3月份生产者价格涨幅略低于预期之后，交易商周四押注美联储最早可能在7月底的会议上开始降息。 周三，3月份消费者价格读数高于预期--这是月度通胀读数连续第三次出现上行惊喜--促使交易商推高了对美联储首次降息的预期。【原文：The Federal Reserve could start interest-rate cuts as early as its late-July meeting, traders bet on Thursday, after a government report showed producer prices in March rose a bit less than expected. On Wednesday a higher-than-expected reading on March consumer prices -- the third upside surprise in a row on the monthly inflation readings -- prompted traders to push out expectations for a first Fe】

item.title: 独家报道空中客车公司首席执行官称将收购部分 Spirit Aero 工厂，这并非不可能
item.description: 空中客车公司负责人告诉路透社记者，如果波音公司继续推进收购该行业主要供应商之一的计划，那么这家欧洲飞机制造商控制美国和英国 Spirit Aerosystems 公司的两家工厂的可能性 "并非不存在"。【原文：The head of Airbus told Reuters it is "not unlikely" that the European planemaker takes control of two U.S. and UK plants run by Spirit Aerosystems if Boeing goes ahead with plans to buy one of the industry's key suppliers.】

item.title: 韩国被勒令就 2015 年三星并购案向梅森资本支付约 3200 万美元
item.description: 司法部周四表示，韩国已被勒令向纽约对冲基金梅森资本管理公司（Mason Capital Management）支付 3200 多万美元，该纠纷源于 2015 年三星两家关联公司的合并。【原文：South Korea has been ordered to pay New York hedge fund Mason Capital Management more than $32 million, the Ministry of Justice said on Thursday, in a dispute stemming from the 2015 merger of two Samsung affiliates.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯：银行应做好必要时使用贴现窗口的准备
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周四表示，银行需要在麻烦到来之前做好使用美联储贴现窗口的准备。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said Thursday that banks need to be prepared to use the Fed's discount window before trouble arrives.】

item.title: 通知显示，美国联邦航空局拟对部分波音 747-400F 飞机发布适航指令
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局针对某些波音 747-400F 系列飞机提出了一项适航指令，要求在油箱内的某些紧固件环上加盖密封。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration has proposed an airworthiness directive for certain Boeing 747-400F series airplanes that would require applying cap seals to certain fastener collars inside the fuel tanks, according to a federal government notice.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁认为 2024 年通胀将进一步下降，但尚未被完全击垮
item.description: 国际货币基金组织总裁克里斯塔琳娜-格奥尔基耶娃（Kristalina Georgieva）周四表示，通胀放缓的速度快于预期，但还没有完全被打败，她敦促各国央行行长根据新的数据仔细调整他们的降息决定。【原文：Inflation is easing faster than expected but has not been fully defeated, International Monetary Fund chief Kristalina Georgieva said on Thursday, urging central bankers to carefully calibrate their decisions on cutting interest rates to incoming data.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利为儿童心理健康倡议认捐 2,000 万美元
item.description: 摩根士丹利在周四的一份声明中说，该行承诺在五年内向其儿童心理健康倡议提供 2,000 万美元，使其自 2020 年开始的承诺达到 5,000 万美元。【原文：Morgan Stanley pledged $20 million over five years to its children's mental health initiative, bringing its commitment to $50 million since it began in 2020, the bank said in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数降幅超过预期；持续申请失业救济人数上升
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量降幅超过预期，表明劳动力市场仍然相当紧张，尽管一些下岗工人可能需要更长的时间才能找到新工作。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits fell more than expected last week, suggesting that the labor market remained fairly tight, though it could be taking longer for some laid off workers to land new jobs.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚首席执行官伍兹 2023 年薪酬上涨 3
item.description: 埃克森美孚在周四提交的一份监管文件中表示，该石油巨头在 2023 年向首席执行官达伦-伍兹支付了 3,690 万美元的总薪酬，比上年增长了近 3%。【原文：Exxon Mobil paid Chief Executive Officer Darren Woods $36.9 million in total compensation for 2023, up nearly 3% from a year earlier, the oil major said in a regulatory filing on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯表示前景不明朗，数据将推动利率决策
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周四表示，美国央行在降低通胀方面取得了相当大的进展，但同时指出，前景不明朗意味着美联储必须关注即将到来的数据，以制定利率政策。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said on Thursday that the U.S. central bank has made considerable progress lowering inflation, while noting an uncertain outlook means the Fed must watch incoming data to set rate policy.】

item.title: 科罗娜啤酒制造商星座品牌公司预测年度利润高于预期
item.description: 星座品牌公司（Constellation Brands）周四预测年度利润将高于华尔街预期，尽管通胀严重，但其核心啤酒品牌的需求仍将保持稳定。【原文：Constellation Brands forecast annual profit above Wall Street expectations on Thursday, banking on resilient demand for its core beer brands despite sticky inflation.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将利率维持在历史高位，发出即将降息的信号
item.description: 欧洲中央银行周四将利率维持在创纪录的高位，但发出了一个更明确的信号，即随着欧元区通胀率持续下降，欧洲中央银行可能准备削减利率。【原文：The European Central Bank kept interest rates at record highs on Thursday but sent an even clearer signal that it may be preparing to cut them as euro zone inflation continues to fall.】

item.title: 新调查发现，2024 年全球信贷前景恶化
item.description: 国际信贷组合经理协会的一项调查显示，一些最大金融机构的投资组合和资产经理对全球信贷状况持负面看法。【原文：Portfolio and asset managers at some of the largest financial institutions hold a negative outlook on global credit conditions, according to a survey by the International Association of Credit Portfolio Managers.】

item.title: 特斯拉投资者可能在股东大会上提出集体谈判动议
item.description: 挪威养老基金KLP周四表示，特斯拉投资者KLP可能会要求该汽车制造商的年度股东大会解决首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）不愿参与集体谈判的问题。【原文：Tesla investor KLP may ask the automaker's annual general meeting to address CEO Elon Musk's reluctance to engage in collective bargaining, the Norwegian pension fund said on Thursday.】

item.title: CarMax 第四季度利润下降近 27
item.description: 周四，二手车零售商 CarMax 公布的第四季度利润下降了近 27%，主要是受售出车辆利润率下降的影响。【原文：Pre-owned vehicle retailer CarMax posted a nearly 27% drop in fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, hurt by decreased profitability from units sold.】

item.title: 亚马逊首席执行官表示，亚马逊看到了降低履约网络成本的机会
item.description: 亚马逊公司首席执行官安迪-贾西（Andy Jassy）表示，在最近几个月裁减了多个部门的员工后，这家电子商务公司看到了降低其履行网络成本的机会。【原文：Amazon.com CEO Andy Jassy said the e-commerce firm sees opportunity to reduce costs in its fulfillment network, after trimming staff in a number of divisions over the recent months.】

item.title: 降息希望减退，期货下滑
item.description: 周四，美国股指期货下跌，原因是国债收益率仍在高位徘徊，而前一天的通胀数据偏高，引发了华尔街的严重抛售，降低了美联储 6 月降息的希望。【原文：U.S. stock index futures dipped on Thursday as Treasury yields remained elevated a day after a hot inflation reading triggered a bruising Wall Street sell-off, diminishing hopes of a June rate cut by the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 工作组称多边开发银行仍需努力实施改革
item.description: 世界银行和其他六家多边银行在将气候变化等全球挑战纳入其议程方面取得了良好进展，但根据一项跟踪改革的工具显示，大多数银行在实施其他必要改革方面还有很长的路要走。【原文：The World Bank and six other multilateral banks have made good progress in integrating global challenges like climate change into their agendas, but most have miles to go in implementing other needed reforms, a tool tracking the reforms shows.】

item.title: 与越南房地产公司有关的顶级资产被控诈骗数十亿美元
item.description: 越南有史以来最大金融诈骗案的主谋、Van Thinh Phat 控股集团董事长张美兰（Truong My Lan）在经过长达一个月的审判后，于本周四被判处死刑。【原文：The mastermind of Vietnam's largest-ever financial fraud, Van Thinh Phat Holdings Group Chairwoman Truong My Lan, was sentenced to death on Thursday after a month-long trial.】

item.title: 聚焦：保险费用飙升，美国购车者终于在车价上获得喘息机会
item.description: 达林-戴维斯（Darin Davis）这样的美国购车者受到了一种新形式的车价冲击。【原文：A new form of sticker shock has hit American car buyers like Darin Davis.】

item.title: 美国将赌注押在气候友好型农业上；专家怀疑其是否足够气候友好型
item.description: 乔-拜登总统的政府正在为农民提供资金，鼓励他们采用在土壤中储存碳的方法来应对气候变化，但路透社对土壤科学专家的采访以及对美国农业部研究的回顾表明，人们对这种方法是否有效表示怀疑。【原文：President Joe Biden's administration is offering farmers money for adopting practices that store carbon in the soil to fight climate change, but Reuters interviews with soil science experts and a review of U.S. Department of Agriculture research indicate doubt that the approach will be effective.】

item.title: 早间竞价：市场受美联储减息疑虑影响，欧洲央行下一步行动
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 评级下调和政府调查后，中国万科股价和债券下跌
item.description: 在标准普尔（S&P）取消了中国万科的投资评级后，中国万科的股价和美元债券周四下跌，该开发商证实了一名高管正在接受调查的报道，这给陷入困境的房地产行业雪上加霜。【原文：China Vanke's shares and dollar bonds dropped on Thursday after S&P stripped its investment-grade status and the developer confirmed reports that an executive was being investigated, adding to woes for the embattled property sector.】

item.title: Kering 任命奢侈品行业资深人士坎蒂诺为古驰副首席执行官
item.description: 法国奢侈品集团开云集团（Kering）周四任命前路易-威登（Louis Vuitton）和普拉达（Prada）传播主管斯特凡诺-坎蒂诺（Stefano Cantino）为古驰（Gucci）副首席执行官，以帮助指导该意大利品牌的复兴。【原文：French luxury group Kering on Thursday named former Louis Vuitton and Prada communications executive Stefano Cantino as deputy CEO of Gucci to help steer a revival of the Italian label.】

item.title: 外国投资者抢购低价日本股票
item.description: 在截至 4 月 5 日的一周里，外国投资者抢购日本股票，因为他们在 3 月底日本股票大幅下跌后，在国内机构的利润预订中寻找价值机会。【原文：Foreign investors snapped up Japanese stocks in the week ended April 5, as they sought value opportunities following a substantial drop in late-March amid profit booking by domestic institutions.】

item.title: Meta 将模糊包含裸体内容的 Instagram 消息，这是保护青少年安全的最新举措
item.description: Instagram 的母公司 Meta 周四表示，Instagram 将测试模糊含有裸体内容的信息的功能，以保护青少年的安全，防止潜在的骗子接触到他们，同时努力消除人们对其应用程序上有害内容的担忧。【原文：Instagram will test features that blur messages containing nudity to safeguard teens and prevent potential scammers from reaching them, its parent Meta said on Thursday as it tries to allay concerns over harmful content on its apps.】

item.title: 日元疲软可能阻碍日本央行尽快加息
item.description: 日元汇率跌至 34 年来的新低，使日本央行考虑下一次加息时机的工作变得更加复杂，因为由此导致的进口成本上升不仅会推高通胀，还会损害本已疲软的消费和整体经济。【原文：The yen's fresh slide to a 34-year low complicates the Bank of Japan's deliberations on the timing of a next interest rate hike, as a resulting rise in import costs pushes up inflation but also hurts already weak consumption and the broader economy.】
